file_content.text: I've docked inside the Emperor's fortress. No sign of opposition.
I'm in, as well. Perhaps we caught the Emperor napping.
I took some cannon fire getting in, but my shields held up.
The Meedees detect enemy forces converging on my hangar. Looks like I drew the short straw.
Everyone disembark. Follow your routes to the objective. No surrender, no retreat.
Remember the fallen, and do not fail them.
Let's go save the galaxy.
Are you saying we're on a suicide mission?
This is a fight to the death?
We cannot afford to fail. We'll never get another chance.
Should I bring everyone aboard my ship?
What about my crew?
This is no place for the unprepared. Bring only your strongest ally.
I'll see you in the throne room. May the Force protect us all. Master Braga out....
I can feel him. He's waiting. He'd be laughing, if he still knew how.
Who's laughing? I don't hear anything.
The Emperor isn't afraid. He's just quiet. Still. All he feels is... cold rage.
The Sith believe hatred makes them strong, but that's a lie. It's a weakness.
That's why he'll fail.
We don't understand what he is, what he can do.
Anger is born from fear. The Emperor knows his time is up. We'll be alright.
Don't worry, Kira.
The Emperor is the strongest Sith alive. Stronger than any of us.
I don't care what Master Braga wants. I'll take the Emperor's head, first chance I get.
The feeling is mutual.
Can't you feel the deaths that happened here? Others tried--and failed.
We shouldn't have come. This is a trap.
You'll be safe on the ship. I'll take one of the others.
Stay here, Kira.
This isn't about me. We're all at risk!
The Emperor has no power over us if we stick together. Face your fear.
You're coming with me.
I won't let him take me. Never again.
You're a danger to this mission. You're confined to quarters.
I've had enough of you.
I'm trying to save us. We can't win!
The docking bay sealed shut behind us. Retreat is not an option. I'll go with you.
Emperor = unable to influence T7 circuits // Jedi + T7 = perfect team
Maybe I should stay and look after Kira? Poor kid--look at her shaking....
Teeseven, you're in charge here. Let's go, Sergeant.
Sergeant Rusk, let's move out.
I'll take point. Victory or death.
No offense, my little friend, but you're easier to fix if you get hurt.
You're with me, Teeseven.
Droids = more resilient than organic life // T7 = Jedi best bet!
Teeseven and Sergeant Rusk will watch Kira. Come on, Doc.
I need you for this, Doc.
There's no place I'd rather be.
That makes sense. I'm better in a fight.
Further delay = mission failure // Time to act = now
Welcome back, friend. We've made astounding progress, thanks to you.
Analysis of the Hoth data has laid bare the entire defense grid of the Emperor's fortress. There are weaknesses we can exploit.
Even better, we understand how the cloaking device protects the fortress. We've just jury-rigged a scanner that sees through it.
At last, the Emperor is within our reach.
This is the beginning of the end for the Sith Empire.
The Force is with us.
We'll be the dawn that breaks the night.
It seems almost impossible our plans came together this fast.
So quickly?
You're with the best strike team in the galaxy. For us, nothing is impossible.
We can seize that scum right now. Force the Empire to surrender.
Let's get him.
Patience. Our victory will be assured when we leave nothing to chance.
Our vessels are being prepped for the journey to Dromund Kaas. Long-range scanners will receive upgrades to detect the Emperor's fortress.
We'll pilot our individual starships to land in different docking bays. Multiple targets will divide the enemy's defenses.
Once we're inside the fortress, we'll each follow an assigned path through the security grid. We'll converge on the Emperor's throne room.
We'll capture the Sith leader, bring him to Tython... and redeem him to the light side of the Force. A perfect victory.
Redeeming the Emperor... you're nothing if not ambitious, Master Braga.
A challenging goal.
Capturing the Emperor will be hard enough. Turning him into an ally... is it even possible?
How will we achieve it?
I convinced a member of the Dark Council. The Emperor will be no different. He's just another Sith.
The Emperor, redeemed to the light side? Impossible.
You can't be serious.
Have you forgotten what you achieved with Bengel Morr and Lord Praven?
It wasn't impossible for you to bring Lord Praven to our side. The Emperor is just another Sith.
Your ally Kira was once a child of darkness. Now she's a Jedi Knight.
Defeating the Sith through violence accomplishes nothing. We must embrace them as our own.
It is the key to a lasting peace that will save countless lives.
Master Braga, we must speak before this plan goes any further. There are those among us who have raised... concerns.
If anyone doubts our ability to do this, let them object. I'm sure we can dispel their doubts.
I can resolve their fears.
I thought you supported this plan, Master Satele.
Are you among them?
I do, but I don't speak for all Jedi. I must ensure their voices are heard.
Now that I've heard the plan, I have my own objections.
They aren't the only ones.
You have a gift for irony.
I've always considered your plan reckless, Master Braga. Now your former team member comes to me with a disturbing vision you chose to ignore.
Jomar, we discussed this. You should be in the kolto baths. You still haven't recovered from your attack on Tatooine.
It was during my healing meditations that I saw a vision of this Jedi. She was falling to the dark side--becoming a Sith!
It was during those healing meditations that I saw a vision of this Jedi. He was falling to the dark side--becoming a Sith!
Nothing in this galaxy could make me join our enemies.
That would never happen.
You will fall--and others with you. I saw it.
You didn't tell me about this vision when he first shared it with you?
You knew, Master?
Tell us exactly what you saw happening. It might help me avoid such a terrible outcome.
I'd like to hear more of this.
You stood on the red sands of Korriban--the center of Sith power. Your eyes were burning coals.
I saw you torturing your own crew. They screamed for mercy, but your heart was cold. Alien. Sith.
The future is forever in motion. Events that appear certain today are impossible tomorrow.
Must I remind the Council that the Jedi do not pass judgments based solely on visions?
If you take her on this mission, it will fail. I should go instead.
If you take him on this mission, it will fail. I should go instead.
If Master Satele and the others agree with you, I'll step aside.
I will obey the Council.
The Emperor's fortress is no place for a wounded Jedi.
You aren't ready.
Better me than you!
That will be enough. I fear emotions have clouded judgment.
You're angry over being left behind. You want to replace me.
This is all about your ego.
I want to save this galaxy.
We all do--but that hope must never descend into passion. I fear that yours has.
I've known this Jedi since she was Master Orgus's Padawan. She has saved lives across the galaxy. I do not doubt her loyalty.
I've known this Jedi since he was Master Orgus's Padawan. He has saved lives across the galaxy. I do not doubt his loyalty.
Jomar, Master Kaedan... I appreciate your concerns, but I do not share them. I see no reason to delay Master Braga's mission.
Thank you, Master Satele. And you, Master Kiwiiks.
I appreciate your support.
No thanks are needed. With the Force as guide, I simply follow my conscience, nothing more.
Maybe it would be better if someone else went in my place, just to be safe.
Are you certain?
You're essential to our mission's success. I will not leave you behind.
If you're done questioning my loyalty, we have a galaxy to save.
Then let's get on with it.
No! This is wrong! I know what I saw!
Master Braga, I demand you reconsider. There's too much at stake here.
The time for debates is over. The hour of our victory approaches.
My friends, we depart for the Emperor's fortress at once. We'll coordinate our assault once we're all inside. May the Force be with us!
Master Braga... Leeha Narezz is on her way with the technical readouts to the Emperor's fortress.
I knew you two would be unstoppable together.
I look forward to working with her again.
Indeed we were.
I'm not sure what to make of her notions about droids using the Force.
Leeha has interesting ideas.
Nor do I. Then again, great advances in knowledge often come after a leap of faith.
A Republic soldier who helped our mission joined my crew.
We've gained a new ally, too.
Good. We'll need capable soldiers--at least for a little while longer.
A good soldier is always welcome, especially where you're headed.
I can see why you sent me. Leeha isn't much of a warrior.
Our strike team is weak.
She's one of the sharpest minds in our order. If we're to survive this war, we'll need people like her.
Your successes on Hoth and Balmorra have been nothing short of extraordinary. Our plan to capture the Emperor is already taking shape.
Come back to Tython, my friend. We'll discuss the particulars here. Master Braga out.
However, there's still no word from Sajar. It isn't like him to go this long without checking in.
I need you on Quesh immediately. Secure our base there and find Sajar. Master Braga out.
This has been the first of many victories for us. Balmorra will be another.
[NOTE: This line will introduce Event 1, "The Emperor's Wrath."] THIS SHOULD NOT BE NEEDED, ASSUMING THE QUEST FLOW STAYS THE SAME
Master Braga... your Padawan and the Republic base are safe. The Imperials attacked, but I drove them off.
Sajar is turning himself in to the Jedi Council. He confessed to committing war crimes against Imperial prisoners.
I can't believe it. Rest assured, Master Satele will question him personally.
I trust you'll show the proper discretion until this matter has been fully investigated.
The Emperor's personal executioner was hunting your Padawan. He seemed more interested in meeting me, though.
A Sith tried to kill Sajar.
Based on what I witnessed, your Padawan is at risk of returning to the dark side.
I believe he's guilty.
Hmm. We'll send someone to bring him home immediately.
If someone asks me what happened, do you expect me to lie?
You want me keeping secrets?
Of course not--but Sajar faces mistrust and prejudice because of his past. Until we know all the facts, he deserves protection.
Sajar apologizes for the confusion, but secrecy was required to fool the enemy.
I knew there was a good reason for his actions. I look forward to hearing from him.
Sajar had a crisis of confidence, but I set him on the right path. He isn't afraid to fight anymore.
That may be so, but Quesh is no place for a Padawan. I'll have him transported somewhere safe.
Thank you for confirming Sajar is well. Do you have anything else to report?
The Emperor's personal executioner was hunting your Padawan.
I met the Emperor's Wrath.
I sent him away empty-handed, but he said we'd meet again. What do you know about this "Emperor's Wrath"?
The Council has heard that title, but little more. I'm sure his interest in you is related to the Darth Angral incident.
If the Republic is going to hold this planet, they'll need more than a few token Padawans guarding the bases.
Quesh needs more Jedi.
I'll pass your advice along to Master Satele. Unfortunately, as the war spreads, our numbers remain limited.
My mission here is complete. I'm preparing to leave Quesh.
No, nothing.
Our strike team is pursuing a new goal on the ice planet Hoth. We're up against pirates and Imperials there. We need your help.
Travel to Hoth, and contact Jedi Knight Leeha Narezz. She'll explain more.
The next stage of our plan is almost ready to begin. Your efforts on Hoth and Balmorra succeeded beyond our greatest hopes.
I won't delay you any longer. You're still needed on Balmorra.
May the Force be with you. Master Braga out....
I've lost contact with my Padawan under unusual--and dangerous--circumstances. You're uniquely qualified to deal with this.
I'll do everything I can, Master. Tell me the situation.
I'm happy to help.
What is it that makes me so special?
How so?
Your former student--Kira--has much in common with mine.
Capturing the Emperor is more important than anything.
I already have a mission.
My student was the inspiration for that mission.
Sajar is no ordinary Padawan. He was once a Sith Lord. A member of the Empire's Dark Council.
We dueled on Dantooine. Fought for three days. I won when I convinced him to abandon the dark side and train as a Jedi.
You turned a Dark Council member to the Jedi? Incredible.
That's amazing, Master.
Your own victories are no less impressive. Bengel Morr and the former Lord Praven now serve the light side because of you.
You're no stranger to redeeming the enemy. Thanks to you, the former Lord Praven makes great strides with the Jedi.
Many who serve the dark side would change if offered the chance.
He must have taken a lot of persuading.
How did you do that?
Our debate was a duel in itself. I appealed to the good in him no matter how he attacked me.
Allowing a Sith to live is hardly a "win." You've only delayed the inevitable.
I don't call that a victory.
If you could see how much he's changed, you wouldn't say that.
Sajar has fully embraced the Jedi way. Whatever has happened, it isn't his fault.
He was guarding a Republic base on the planet Quesh when the Empire invaded and attacked our territories.
The Empire wouldn't commit its forces if Quesh wasn't worth the effort.
Quesh must be valuable.
It's the largest adrenal production center in the galaxy. They're a major military commodity, especially now that war has broken out again.
You trusted Sajar to guard a Republic base in a war zone?
Why was your Padawan there?
When I sent him, Quesh was peaceful. Quiet. A good place for meditation while also serving the Republic.
If you're recruiting Jedi to fight there, consider me signed up.
I'll put an end to that.
My Padawan's safety is entwined with the battle for Quesh.
I just spoke with a soldier at Sajar's base. It's surrounded by Imperial forces, and my Padawan refuses to act.
Without Jedi help, that base will fall. My Padawan won't answer his holo.
Sounds like he's afraid of something, but what?
Only a strong Jedi can help Sajar and save the base. I'm transmitting the planet's coordinates now. Master Braga out....
Go. He needs you, and you need him.
You haven't led me astray yet, Master Orgus.
Yes, old friend.
Master? Why would I need Sajar?
I need him?
Can I look forward to you dropping by like this for the rest of my life?
Not you again.
Uh... you alright? The holo transmission's over.
It's a Jedi thing. None of your business.
This sounds urgent. We should go to Quesh right away.
Jedi aren't cowards. Neither are Sith. This Padawan's loyalties are divided.
Master Braga... the mission to Balmorra was a success. We have the cloaking device prototype.
Outstanding. I never doubted you for a moment.
How did you find working with my old friend Warren? I've always been impressed by his keen insights.
His intuition was critical. I couldn't have found the objective without him.
I found him invaluable.
He badly misinterpreted some decisions I was forced to make. He means well, but it was troubling.
[Lie] He may be slipping.
Hmm. Don't let it bother you. My faith in both of you remains unchanged.
Warren has a talent for finding the truth.
He reads people well.
Those gifts are vital to achieving our ultimate goal.
His keen insights were limited to letting me do all the hard work.
Warren is weak.
Warren was the order's greatest soldier in his day--now that role falls to you.
Thanks to your efforts, we finally have all we need to capture the Emperor and end this war.
You've brought us a great leap closer to finding the Emperor, but there's a new problem.
We'll accomplish great things together, my friend. That's a promise.
Protect my young friend. May the Force be with you.
